@jcaiMR I thought the plan for future was to read from config db once. Are we still planning on keeping dynamic reading?

> @jcaiMR I thought the plan for future was to read from config db once. Are we still planning on keeping dynamic reading?

In last meeting we talked a little bit,  maybe part of configuration like option79 enable/disable may still needed, and keep the original monitor thread there can give a clear message when config changed, so I keep it there first.
Required for 202012
@kellyyeh @yxieca can you please add the label? is it only for 202012?

@kellyyeh , @jcaiMR to review
@kellyyeh @yxieca Can we merge this?

Is there a swsscommon build for 201911 that can be used here?

> Is there a swsscommon build for 201911 that can be used here?

Yes, updated

Can you update the Azure pipeline to use Buster instead of Bullseye?

Also, I don't think the version-specific boost dev packages need to be used?

> Can you update the Azure pipeline to use Buster instead of Bullseye?
> 
> Also, I don't think the version-specific boost dev packages need to be used?

Encountered error:  
libboost-serialization-dev : Depends: libboost-serialization1.67-dev but it is not going to be installed
 libboost-system-dev : Depends: libboost-system1.67-dev but it is not going to be installed
 libboost-thread-dev : Depends: libboost-thread1.67-dev but it is not going to be installed

Had to specify the version for dependencies to be installed successfully

> > Can you update the Azure pipeline to use Buster instead of Bullseye?
> > Also, I don't think the version-specific boost dev packages need to be used?
> 
> Encountered error: libboost-serialization-dev : Depends: libboost-serialization1.67-dev but it is not going to be installed libboost-system-dev : Depends: libboost-system1.67-dev but it is not going to be installed libboost-thread-dev : Depends: libboost-thread1.67-dev but it is not going to be installed
> 
> Had to specify the version for dependencies to be installed successfully

Oh this is weird, I'll take a look later after the merge.

With this change, `src/relay.cpp` will be almost 1000 lines. I think it might be worth it for maintainability purposes to reorganize this file in the future. Maybe split it into separate files, or use C++ classes to group functions and structures used?

> With this change, `src/relay.cpp` will be almost 1000 lines. I think it might be worth it for maintainability purposes to reorganize this file in the future. Maybe split it into separate files, or use C++ classes to group functions and structures used?

Agreed, I will create another PR for this.
Is there unit test to cover this change?
@yxieca the unit test PR (#5) is still open, should we merge that in first, then this?

> @yxieca the unit test PR (#5) is still open, should we merge that in first, then this?

Working on cleaning up unittest PR. Will merge unittest first

> > @yxieca the unit test PR (#5) is still open, should we merge that in first, then this?
> 
> Working on cleaning up unittest PR. Will merge unittest first

Sure. when will #5 ready for review/merge?
